title.rendered: The Brain Project Launches!

content.rendered:
I was asked to participate in the 2017 Brain Project for the Baycrest Foundation. They provided me with a 3 dimensional blank brain which I painted with my pixel style.  The project was a lot of fun and my Brain has already been sponsored by Muse (they donated money to the foundation to have have their name travel with my brain), so I am pleased that my efforts have raised them a donation for their great cause.

All the brains will be touring around Toronto for next while, please let me know if you spot my brain anywhere. Also if you visit their website, they have an interactive 3D view of the brain. They have a people choice award for the most popular brain, please vote for my brain on the same page (you can vote every day!).

About the Project:

The Brain Project is a large-scale outdoor exhibit that brings brain health, art and imagination to the streets of Toronto. In 2016, The Brain Project launched its inaugural exhibit across the city to start a public conversation about brain health and bring awareness to diseases like Alzheimer’s.

As The Brain Project returns for its second year, one hundred artists from around the world will transform blank brain sculptures into beautiful, energetic and thought-provoking pieces of art. The sculptures are sponsored by corporations and philanthropists, and will be displayed in more than 15 locations around Toronto and the GTA.

Funds raised through the project are donated to Baycrest Health Sciences, a global leader in brain health and aging.

title.rendered: We have expanded to Etsy!

content.rendered:
I am happy to announce that we have expanded and created an etsy shop for our silks screen prints. These are the same prints that are offered on this website, we are just looking to expand our customer base.

Please visit us there and add us to your favourites!

www.etsy.com/ca/shop/FineArtByJustin

title.rendered: Artist Project – Crystal Head Vodka Painting

content.rendered:
I’ve been asked to participate in a promotion for Crystal Head Vodka for the Artist Project. They asked me to paint this skull bottle in my pixel style.

I’m on the fence on whether to paint a pixelated face or one of my pattern, I’m leaning towards one of my patterns.

I’ll post updates of the project as I go, be sure to follow my Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter.

title.rendered: Project with Kristen Au is complete

content.rendered: I have just finished a project with the lovely and talented Kristen Au. The project consisted of a silk screen print series as well as a painting. For the print I decided to use a portrait and for the painting I decided to use a bodyscape. I plan on exploring more bodyscapes with my upcoming projects.

title.rendered: Bob Weir at The Carlu, Review

content.rendered:
What a great birthday show! The night before I was at the Mars Hotel show at the Mod Club when I heard Bob Weir was playing in Toronto the next night! Ticket sales were closed and it was for a charity. I was determined not be be shut out and managed to get myself a ticket. Again, what a great birthday surprise, he did a small discussion for the charity on ingenuity and discovery and then played an acoustic set. As you can see from the photo I got pretty close.

Setlist:

Loose Lucy
Peggy-O
KC Moan
Easy to Slip
Dear Prudence
Friend of the Devil
Bird Song
Jack Straw

Encore:
Ripple

title.rendered: Concert Poster Collection

content.rendered:
One of the reasons for my recent push into silkscreen printing is my concert poster collection, many of which are silkscreens. Here is my collection so far. All posters are first edition, and if they have any special signatures or things to note I will list them in the descriptions (I downloaded these previews from Internet so you wont see my actual copies with signatures , no reason other than it was too much work to photograph all of these). The older Blues, Jazz and Grateful Dead posters are holding up well for being almost 50 years old.

title.rendered: Paul McCartney 2015 Toronto review

content.rendered:
Another great show by Paul McCartney at the ACC in Toronto. Not a different show template than the show saw 5 years ago, but  great new songs for me to hear (A few of his songs and and intro stories are the same). Some of the  songs I was very thrilled to hear were, Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!, Carry That Weight, Let Me Roll It, Lovely Rita, and One After 909. I was thrilled to hear most of them though. He certainly packs a lot of songs in and plays for almost 3 hours giving us our monies worth, quite amazing. I also picked up the concert lithograph poster, which you can see on the right.

title.rendered: Primus & the Chocolate Factory, Danforth Music Hall Review

content.rendered:
The Primus concerts were amazing.
I went to both shows this past weekend at the Danforth Music Hall and was blown away by their creativity. They played the first set with a simple stage and all their old classic songs. The second set is where the insanity began. The recreated quite a few songs to Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (Gene Wilder Version) as an edited version of the movie played in the background. Both nights I had a big smile all night long.

The second night I picked up an awesome poster from a UK show which was signed by the band. The Toronto posters were good, but the UK poster was amazing.

Songs that stood out to me were The Toys Go Winding Down, and Southbound Pachyderm on the first night. The second night, Mr. Krinkle and Here Come the Bastards. Of course the OompaLoompa songs were amazing, I had a video but it got corrupted.. 🙁

title.rendered: Grateful Dead at Soldiers Field

content.rendered:
After 21 years, I finally attended another Grateful Dead Show. It was everything I expected it to be and I had a great time. Chicago was a great city, I had a an easy time travelling around the city, pizza was the best, Soldiers Field was a good venue. I picked up many posters, but my favourite was a staff security shirt which is pictured below, it took a lot of work to get a staff member to part with it after the last night.

I know there was a lot of Trey haters, but he did a great job, awesome jams, he was the right choice. Some of the highlights for me were pretty much the entire first night, especially Wheel > Crazy Fingers > Music Never Stopped, the entire second set, and drums was amazing this show. For the second show I really liked the Golden Road, West LA Fadeaway, One more Saturday Night. And for the last night the Estimated Prophet,  Throwing Stones and Cassidy really stood out.

Here are the set lists.

title.rendered: October 2104 Newsletter – ArtBomb info

content.rendered:
Two ArtBomb auctions and a party!

My art always seems to move slowly in the summer, but once fall arrives it is time to ramp things up again. A great way to start is with ArtBomb, in the next 2 weeks we have 2 auctions coming up.

Art Shows

Nude Study to go up for Auction on Artbomb
October 31st, 2014

My latest painting (Nude Study with Pixels, please see below) will be going up for auction on Artbomb on Friday October 31st.

Bidding is open 6am and closed at 11pm EST (3am – 8pm PST). Works are delivered anywhere, ready to hang.

Click here to visit ArtBomb.
View this on my website for more information.

Artbomb and Spoke Club Party
November 6th, 2014

On November 6th, 2014 Artbomb will again be throwing a party/art show in collaboration with the Spoke Club. As part of the ticket price each guest will receive an 8″ x 8″ painting. Four of which were created by me.

Tickets are $59 each (yes, you can own one of my paintings for $59). The paintings are randomly distributed among guests in hopes that it will encourage trading among guests to get their favourite piece. Click here to purchase your tickets.

My painting “Njambi” will be on display and for sale at the show in the silent auction. Last year my painting sold in the silent auction so be sure to attend if you want a chance to own this beautiful painting.

View this on my website for more information.

The Spoke Club
600 King Street West, 4th Floor
Toronto, ON, M5V 1M3

In the Studio

Nude Study with Pixels
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 60″ x 36″

Breaking away from portraits and playing with more subtle colours and tones.

title.rendered: Swing King painting debuts at Rainbow Cinemas Gallery

content.rendered:
Today I am setting up a new art show at Rainbow Cinemas Gallery in Market Square Toronto. My latest painting titled “Swing King” which was just finished will be one of the 6 paintings on display at the show. Swing King is inspired by Frankie Manning, the father of Lindy Hop (Swing Dancing). The pixels are dancing shoes. The show will hang for the entire month of March.

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis in Toronto Ontario. Inside the theatre entrance are large glass display walls which you can view without going to a movie, my paintings are within one of those walls. Visit my art show page for more detailed directions and instructions.

excerpt.rendered: Today I am setting up a new art show at Rainbow Cinemas Gallery in Market Square Toronto.

title.rendered: Furthur Paradise Waits Review at Riviera Maya

content.rendered:
Last week I had the extreme good fortune to attend the Furthur concerts at the Hard Rock Resort, Riviera Maya, Mexico. Twenty-five years ago when I first started seeing the Grateful Dead, we typically drove around in beat up vans or cars, and slept in the back seat at rest areas and parking lots. At these shows in mexico, we stayed at an all-inclusive 4 star resort and received foot massages between shows (dancing on concrete is hard on your feet).

I seen the Grateful Dead play 150 times and Furthur only once before this and I have to say they were at the top of their game. As far as the shows go, all I can say is Mind Blown! Perhaps I say that every time, or maybe it is because in the last 20 years I have only seen Bob and Phil play 3 or 4 times. I also caught the surprise Bob Weir acoustic set, I got front row for that.

Recently I have been on a Pig Pen era kick, I pretty much only listen to shows pre 1973 and have been loving all the older songs which the dead never played in the 90s when I was touring, so I was really excited that Furthur has brought back the old repertoire . I know the last 4 years they have played it all, yet I never got to hear it live though. I got to hear many songs for the first time, Cosmic Charlie, Pride of Cucamonga, Unbroken Chain, Viola Lee Blues, Mason’s Children, Cryptical Envelopment, The Mountain Song,  St. Stephen, The Golden Road, Eleven, Death Don’t Have No Mercy, and At a Siding / Terrapin Flyer.

The best part of the shows was the second set of the last night, Dark Star  > Morning Dew > Dark Star > St. Stephen > Eleven > Death Don’t Have No Mercy. I wanted to hear those songs, but in that order in the original way they used to play it was too much to ask. So Grateful.

Here are the setlists:

Crazy Fingers >

title.rendered: Art Battle & ArtBomb Party Update

content.rendered:
Last night I attended an awesome party hosted by Art Battle & ArtBomb at the Steam Whistle Brewery.  The night consisted of a 45 minute Art Battle and a silent auction of ArtBomb artist paintings including my own. I had a last-minute change of paintings, originally my painting Samantha was supposed to be at the event but we ended up having Engineered Beauty in the auction. I am happy to say that the painting was sold.

The art battle artists are all talented, and I am amazed that they can produce such great work in 45 minutes and in front of a crowd. Two paintings that really impressed me are below. The painting on the left is by Keito Morimoto and the right is painted by Danilo Ursini.

I had a last-minute change of paintings, originally my painting Samantha was supposed to be at the event […]

title.rendered: Two New Contemporary Paintings Complete

content.rendered:
I have just finished 2 new paintings using the same model and photograph but with quite different effects.

Both of these pieces will be available at the ArtBomb and Art Battle Holiday coming up on December 18th. This party will be full of great Canadian art and artists.

For the larger sized painting we have more pixels and detail with 2 types of blue pixels in the background. An optical illusion is created when the blue pixel background is seen against the black and white foreground. The effect is that the background seems to disappear when held up against the lighter colours.

The second painting is much smaller so the effect ends up being very abstract. I alternated the pixel background with orange and blue as well.

title.rendered: Eddie Izzard at Massey Hall: Nov 13th

content.rendered:
Last week I was pleased to catch Eddie Izzard at Massey Hall in Toronto.

I have been waiting for a chance to see him live after discovering him on youtube, most notably his Death Star Canteen bit (which he used to launch new new jokes at this show).

I loved his style, he would kind of ramble on about many topics and then tie them all together. Of course he took advantage of Toronto’s infamous Mayor Rob Ford for many jokes.


5/5 Stars

Eddie Izzard
November 13th
Massey Hall
178 Victoria St
Toronto,
ON
M5B 1T7

title.rendered: Darkstar Orchestra at Danforth Music Hall: Nov 14

content.rendered:
My favorite cover band came back into town last week, Darkstar Orchestra. They replicate Grateful Dead concerts and do an amazing job at it too.

For this concert they played a show from  April 4th 1982 , Cameron Indoor Stadium – Duke University Durham NC. For an extra encore they threw in “My Sisters And Brothers” which was a Jerry Garcia Band staple and awesome to hear live.

If I had any complaints it would only be for the venue, the floors are slanted which makes it a bit tricky to dance on.


4/5 Stars

Darkstar Orchestra
November 14th
Danforth Music Hall
147 Danforth Ave
Toronto,
ON
M4K 1N2

title.rendered: New Contemporary Painting titled "Njambi"

content.rendered:
I am pleased to announce and reveal my latest painting which is titled “Njambi”. I am very pleased with this painting and it will be the second painting (the first piece being Amelie) in a new direction towards more subtle and abstract paintings.

With this painting I played with 2 different shaped pixels and added a highlight background behind every pixel shape.

I will be submitting this piece to a Canadian art show, more details to follow if it is accepted into the show.

title.rendered: Contemporary painting "Engineered Beauty" is now complete

content.rendered:
My latest painting which is titled “Engineered Beauty” has just been finished. It is a pixel painting using 4 different shapes for pixels; circles, squares, triangles, and hexagons.

This painting was inspired by a dancer and friend. This is my second contemporary painting to be inspired by a dancer. It will be on display at Toronto Lindy Hop’s Annual CABARET on November 30th! More information about the event is here.

title.rendered: Chelsea Light Moving: September 14, 2013

content.rendered:
Thurston Moore’s new band, Chelsea Light Moving played in Hamilton and I was very pleased to catch it. As a long standing Sonic Youth fan I was amazed that I got to see this for free at Hamilton’s street festival, Supercrawl. While Thurston may cringe to hear this, what I liked most about it was that is sounded just like new Sonic Youth songs, which is what I came to hear. It was very surreal music with the occasional punk/thrashy edge. I hope to hear more of Chelsea Light Moving in the future.I don’t have a setlist to give, if one pops up online I will repost it.


5 / 5 Stars

title.rendered: Contemporary Artist Kyle Tonkens creates painting from my colours

content.rendered:
I have been recently honored by Artist Kyle Tonkens. He contacted me and asked me to pick some colours which he then used for a painting which he named “Justin Blayney’s Choices”.

The colours I chose where Cerulean Blue and Cadmium Orange and this is the great painting that Kyle created with those colours.

Please check out his website.

title.rendered: Phish at Molson Canadian Amphitheatre, 07/22/2013

content.rendered:
After 20 years I finally made it inside a Phish concert and I was totally blown away on how great they were. I was shut outside of many Phish shows at some great California venues (Warfield, Wiltern Theatre, Greek theatre and more I’m sure) back when I was following the Grateful Dead.

Anyways, lots of great jamming, I plan to see the whenver possible from now on, below is the setlist.

Set 1:
The Moma Dance >
Chalk Dust Torture
Undermind
Army of One
Halley’s Comet >
Twist
Bouncing Around the Room
Stash, Yarmouth Road
Tube >
Ocelot >
Suzy Greenberg

Set 2:
Down with Disease >
Also Sprach Zarathustra >
Free >
Piper >
Tweezer >
Silent in the Morning >
Backwards Down the Number Line >
Cavern >
David Bowie

Encore:
Loving Cup >
The Squirming Coil
Tweezer

5/
5stars

Justin Blayney

I was shut outside of many Phish shows at some great California venues (Warfield, Wiltern Theatre, Greek theatre and more I’m sure) back when I was following the Grateful Dead. Anyways, lots of […]

title.rendered: July 2012 Newsletter – Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition

content.rendered:
Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition in 2 days!

I have been accepted to TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) again this year which runs from July 5th -7th. My booth is 225, please see the map for more details about my location.

Show Times:
July 5th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 6th: 10:30 am – 7:30 pm
July 7th: 10:30 am – 6:30 pm

Location:
Nathan Philips Square
100 Queen Street West
Toronto, Ontario
M5H 2N1

As the largest juried outdoor art exhibition in Canada, TOAE offers a fresh-air alternative to conventional art shows and galleries. Hundreds of artists participate and an estimated 100,000 visitors attend the exhibition every year. Side by side, established artists, undiscovered talents and innovative students sell their work directly to the public and make lasting connections with art dealers and collectors.

Visit my website for more information

ArtBomb

Last month on Artbomb, my painting At Ease was sold! There was a lot of interest, so I will have 2 more paintings go up for auction soon. Blazing Heart and Focus are the paintings that will go up on the auction block.

In the Studio

Erg Chebbi

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

Inspired by a recent trip to Morocco and the Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes. Continuing to play with different shaped pixels.

 

 

Precious

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 40″ x 30″

Inspired by one of my favourite stories.

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

title.rendered: A Precious Acrylic Painting

content.rendered:
My latest painting is done and just in time too, it will be on display at my booth at TOAE (click for info).

This painting of Gollum is inspired by a story I have been ready every few years since I was a child. I tend to do that with books I like, wait 2-3 years after reading them so I forget just enough to enjoy them again. All comments and feedback are welcome.

Precious
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 40″ x 30″

title.rendered: Primus 3D concert review – Sat June 8

content.rendered:
What an awesome concert, Primus delivers yet again (my 3rd or 4th show). My first 3D concert experience was amazing (I could only imagine if the Grateful Dead or Pink Floyd had this 3D technology at their disposal what they would do). I was also very happy to pick up the Primus limited edition poster for my concert poster collection (I just started it).  It was also nice to see Salad Fingers on the screen during the first song.

This was my first show at the Danforth Music Hall and I had no complaints, a great venue, the sound was good and clear, and the seats were comfy.

I just discovered that Primus plays different shows in consecutive shows, if I had of known before hand I would have gone both nights (they played my favourite song, “The Toys Go Winding Down” on the first night.. sniff).

Here is the setlist:

Set 2
Those Damned Blue-Collar Tweekers
Duchess and the Proverbial Mind Spread
Extinction Burst
Frizzle Fry
Over the Falls
Tragedy’s a’ Comin’
Bob
Jerry Was a Race Car Driver

Set 2
HOINFODAMAN (Rush’s “The Trees” intro)
Dirty Drowning Man
The Pressman
Eternal Consumption Engine
Jilly’s on Smack
Eleven (w/drum intro)
Del Davis Tree Farm
Hamburger Train
Harold of the Rocks

Encore:
Fisticuffs
Tommy the Cat

excerpt.rendered: What an awesome concert, Primus delivers yet again (my 3rd or 4th show). My first 3D concert experience was amazing (I could only imagine if the Grateful Dead or Pink Floyd had this 3D technology at their disposal what they would do). I was also very happy to pick up the Primus limited edition poster […]

title.rendered: My latest contemporary painting – Erg Chebbi

content.rendered:
I am pleased to present my latest painting to the online world which is titled Erg Chebbi. It is named after the place I took the original photo, the Erg Chebbi Sand Dunes in Morocco.

This painting continues in my theme of using different shaped pixels on the same canvas and starting to break away from the more structured grid pieces I have been doing over the last few years (not breaking away much, but a bit).

The painting is 36 inches square and acrylic on canvas. This painting is available for purchase. All comments and feedback are welcome.

title.rendered: April 2013 Newsletter

content.rendered:
The summer is almost here which signals the beginning of quite a few art shows for me. It all starts this weekend at Arts of the Credit, then 2 weeks from now at Insomnia Restaurant on Bloor St. west. Starting at the end of May look for me at ArtBomb, a Canadian online art auction. Details for everything are below.

Arts on the Credit

April 27th and 28th I will once again be at Arts on the Credit with all of my art for sale along with 30 other artists and craftsman. Last year was a great event and I am looking forward to attending again. If you are attending, please print the complimentary admission ticket and bring with you. For this show I have received some media attention and done some promotion. Visit my press release page and you will find links for a TV interview on Rogers Daily and radio interview on HazeFM.

Show Dates:
April 27-28, from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Waterside Inn
15 Stavebank Road South,
Mississauga,
Ontario L5G 2T2
toll-free: (877) 264-7770
(905) 891-7770
Visit my website for more information

Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge

I am pleased to announce that for the month of May my artwork will be on display at Insomnia Restaurant & Lounge on Bloor St., Toronto. I will be hanging on May 6th and open to the public on May 7th for 1 month. I have quite a bit of space at Insomnia and most of my work will be on display. It will be a good mix of my pixelated portrait and pattern paintings.

On May 7th there will be an informal reception at the Restaurant at 8 p.m. All are welcome to attend to come and enjoy the great food and atmosphere of Insomnia. Please let me know if you plan to attend so I can be sure we have table space available. You may view the event and RVSP on my facebook page.

Show Dates:
May 7th – June 2nd, 2013

Insomnia
563 Bloor St. W.
Toronto, ON M5S 1Y6
(416) 588-3907
Visit my website for more information

ArtBomb

I have recently been in talks with Artbomb, which is a Canadian online art auction. This website has daily auctions for unique Canadian artwork, each auction runs for 1 day only.

* Note this has been updated
The first painting we have decided to auction is Orange on Blue Chrome look for it to appear May 10th.

My piece At Ease is TBA…



 

 

In the Studio

Geo
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 24″ x 36″

Geo is a  little looser than my usual pixel paintings.
Geometric Pixels added with a palette knife.

In the Works 

I was inspired to start a new painting by the vast sand dunes and sky during my trip to Morocco. Please check out my blog here to get a clue as to what I am currently painting, it should be done for the Insomnia show.

title.rendered: Moroccan trip to Erg Chebbi Dunes and Transahara Festival

content.rendered: I have just returned from Morocco where I attended a Psytrance festival (Transahara) at the Erg Chebbi Dunes and roamed through the Medina of Marrakesh, what an amazing time I had. I did lots of exploring through Marrakesh, found some great treasures and had fun haggling with the vendors. At the Dunes it was all about enjoying the surroundings and dancing to house music and a bit of trance. Travelling from the Dunes I was just mesmerized by the Atlas Mountains. I took over 1000 photos and here I am sharing some of my favourites with you.

title.rendered: Self portrait of Justin Blayney is complete

content.rendered:
It has been a slow summer for creating art, I have spent most of my time showing my artwork in and around the Toronto area. I have just completed a pixelated self portrait in squares and I am feeling kind of on the fence about it. So I will leave it here for now, all comments and feedback are welcome. It is 36 inches squares and acrylic on canvas. I included the bamboo and table to give it some perspective. Up close it is very abstract and it is very hard to see any image.

One thing I am happy about is that I figured out a way to create more accuracy when painting the squares. I am using painting blind when using squares because of the massive  amounts of taping required.

title.rendered: Pop Art 911 – Punctured Canvas

content.rendered:
At the past TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) I had a bit of an accident, my wall blew down and one of my paintings got scraped and punctured. So the last few days I learned how to repair a punctured canvas. I’m very grateful my art has solid colours so repainting after was relatively simple.

To fix the hole what I did was:
1.  Place a piece of canvas to the back of the painting then attach it in Gesso.
2.  Apply 5 coats of gesso to front to build it up
3. Sand down the Gesso
4. Re-paint

Thats all it took, it looks perfect now, you can’t even see that anything happened. See photos for before and after (sorry photos are different hues, thats from taking photos with different lighting).

title.rendered: Art in the Workplace at MIP

content.rendered:
I spent the evening attending an art show opening at the McMaster Innovation Park (MIP). I went specifically to support my talented and beautiful friend Christine Mathews ( visit her website www.cmbear.net ) who had 3 amazing pieces in the show.  The Exhibit will be available for viewing Monday to Friday 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. in the Atrium building of McMaster Innovation Park from July 22nd through to November 23rd, 2011. All the work at the show is for sale, so please go out and support our local artists.

Christine Mathews – Growth

Christine Mathews – The Lady: Stripped and Bare


Christine Mathews – Flight

I think 60 artists are on display at the show and while all the work was great, a couple of artists jumped out at me.

Joan Krygsman – Circus (www.joankrygsman.com)

David Magakian – The Antagonist (www.davemagak.com)

title.rendered: My daughter got published

content.rendered: My daughter Sierra got published in a book named You’re My Hero, which is a Girl Guide book filled with short submissions from Girl Guides.  I am very pleased that she is so creative and took advantage of this opportunity, I guess she takes after me just a bit. My copy just arrived in the mail (I ordered it online from web link above). The photo to the right is the badge she earned for this accomplishment.

title.rendered: Nguyen Dinh Dang painting

content.rendered: Last week I was on vacation in BC which was very refreshing and inspiring and I did something I have never done before, I bought a painting from a small art store in Victoria. It is from an artist named Nguyen Dinh Dang from Vietnam. There was another painting which I wanted more but I couldn’t afford it, yet something about this painting interested me and still does.
